skill.name: iterative-runner
skill.description: Runs Claude in a retry loop until tests pass or task completes. Use for TDD loops, overnight builds, or any task needing repeated iteration until success. Triggers on: loop until done, keep trying, retry until pass, TDD loop, iterate until tests pass.

content.user_title: Automate retry loops for Claude until tasks complete
content.value_statement: Complex tasks often require multiple iterations to succeed. This skill runs Claude in a persistent loop that keeps retrying until tests pass or completion criteria are met. It includes safety limits to prevent infinite loops and supports TDD workflows, overnight builds, and automated retry logic.
actual_capabilities: Runs Claude in a retry loop until completion criteria are met
Supports TDD workflows with test-iterate-fix cycles
Uses --max-iterations safety limit to prevent infinite loops
Accepts completion promises as success markers
Handles flaky or complex implementations through repeated attempts
limitations: Requires Claude or Claude Code to be installed and accessible
Does not execute tests itself - relies on external test runners
Completion markers must be explicitly included in prompts
Cannot modify external code or files without explicit instructions

use_cases.title: Test-Driven Development
use_cases.description: Iterate on code by writing tests, implementing features, and running tests until all pass in a continuous loop.

use_cases.title: Overnight Build Automation
use_cases.description: Run complex builds or deployments that require multiple attempts without manual intervention until successful.

use_cases.title: Flaky Test Recovery
use_cases.description: Automate retry logic for implementations that need repeated attempts to handle edge cases or race conditions.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Iteration
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement [FEATURE]. Success criteria: [CRITERIA]. Output <promise>DONE</promise> when complete. --max-iterations [N]

prompt_templates.title: TDD Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement feature using TDD: 1) Write failing test, 2) Implement code, 3) Run tests, 4) Fix if failing, 5) Repeat. Output <promise>DONE</promise> when all tests pass. --max-iterations 50

prompt_templates.title: Build with Safety
prompt_templates.prompt: Build [PROJECT]. Requirements: [LIST]. Success: all builds pass. After 15 failed attempts, document blockers. Output <promise>COMPLETE</promise> when done. --max-iterations 100

prompt_templates.title: Complex Feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement [COMPLEX FEATURE] in phases: Phase 1: [GOAL1], Phase 2: [GOAL2], Phase 3: [GOAL3]. Each phase outputs <promise>NEXT</promise>. Final phase outputs <promise>DONE</promise>. --max-iterations 30

output_examples.input: Implement a sorting algorithm using TDD. Write tests first. Output <promise>DONE</promise> when all tests pass. --max-iterations 20
output: Iteration 1: Wrote failing test for empty array case
Iteration 2: Implemented basic sort, tests still failing
Iteration 3: Fixed edge case handling, 2 tests passing
Iteration 4: Optimized performance, all tests passing

output_examples.input: Build the authentication module. Requirements: login, logout, session management. After 10 failed attempts, list blockers. Output <promise>COMPLETE</promise> when done. --max-iterations 50
output: Attempt 1-3: Researching auth patterns and setting up project structure
Attempt 4-6: Implementing login flow with validation
Attempt 7-8: Adding session management and logout functionality
Attempt 9: Fixing edge cases and adding error handling

best_practices: Always specify --max-iterations to prevent runaway loops
Define clear, measurable completion criteria before starting
Use incremental goals for complex tasks to track progress
Include escape hatches that document blockers after repeated failures
anti_patterns: Starting iterations without defining what done looks like
Using vague success criteria like make it work
Running without monitoring for extended overnight builds

faq.question: What tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: Works with Claude and Claude Code on Linux, macOS, and Windows with bash access.

faq.question: What happens if max iterations is reached?
faq.answer: Claude stops and outputs a summary of attempted approaches and any documented blockers.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, combine with existing test runners and build tools through standard shell commands.

faq.question: Is my data safe during iterations?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill only processes prompts locally. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why did my iteration stop early?
faq.answer: Check if the completion promise marker was included in the output. Verify success criteria are met.

faq.question: How is this different from manual retry?
faq.answer: Automates the retry loop with persistent context, reducing manual overhead for repetitive tasks.
